org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers

Class CollectionRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers.AbstractPersistenceRenderer
      • org.freezedry.persistence.keyvalue.renderers.CollectionRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Copyable<PersistenceRenderer>, PersistenceRenderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlatteningCollectionRenderer

    public class CollectionRenderer
extends AbstractPersistenceRenderer
    Renders the subtree of the semantic model that represents a Collection. Collections are rendered as the collection's persistence name followed by the decorated index. For example, a List< String > would be persisted in the following format when using the default decorator and settings: 
     Division.carNames[0] = "civic"
 Division.carNames[1] = "tsx"
 Division.carNames[2] = "accord"

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollectionRenderer

        public CollectionRenderer(KeyValueBuilder builder,
                  java.lang.String openIndex,
                  java.lang.String closeIndex)
        Constructs a CollectionRenderer that is used to render InfoNode representing Collections into key value pairs.
        Parameters:
        builder - The KeyValueBuilder used to flatten the semantic model. The builder calls this class' buildKeyValuePair(InfoNode, String, List, boolean) as part of the recursive algorithm to flatten the semantic model
        indexDecorator - The Decorator for the index.

      • CollectionRenderer

        public CollectionRenderer(KeyValueBuilder builder)
        Constructs a CollectionRenderer that is used to render InfoNode representing Collections into key value pairs. Uses the default the index decorator which prepends a "[" onto the index and appends a "]" to the end of the index. For example, if the index=1 then the index would be decorated to look like [1].
        Parameters:
        builder -

      • CollectionRenderer

        Copy constructor
        Parameters:
        renderer - The CollectionRenderer to copy

    • Method Detail

      • withholdCompoundPersistNameFor

        public boolean withholdCompoundPersistNameFor(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Tells the renderer to withhold the persistence name for the specified Class in instances where the Collection element is compound, and that compound element is the specified Class or a subclass of the specified Class. For example, when we have a List< Map< String, String > > called listOfMaps, then for each list element, we have a Map, and so we would want to render it as listOfMap[i]{key}. Similarly, if we have a List< List< Double > > called matrix, we would want to render it as matrix[i][j].

        For arrays, see the withholdArrayPersistName method.

        Parameters:
        clazz - The specified Class for which to withhold the persistence name
        Returns:
        true if the Class was added; false otherwise
        See Also:
        withholdArrayPersistName

      • removePersistNameWithholding

        public boolean removePersistNameWithholding(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Tells the renderer that it should no longer withhold the persistence name for the specified Class or its subclasses.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The specified Class for which to no longer withhold the persistence name
        Returns:
        true if the Class was removed; false otherwise
        See Also:
        withholdPeristName, withholdArrayPersistName

      • setWithholdCompoundPersistNameForArrays

        public void setWithholdCompoundPersistNameForArrays(boolean isWithhold)
        Tells the renderer to withhold the persistence name for arrays in instances where the Collection element is compound, and that compound element is an array. For example, if we have a List< int[] > > called matrix, we would want to render it as matrix[i][j].
        Parameters:
        isWithhold - true if peristence names are to be withheld; false otherwise
        See Also:
        withholdPeristName

      • buildKeyValuePair

        public void buildKeyValuePair(InfoNode infoNode,
                     java.lang.String key,
                     java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> keyValues,
                     boolean isWithholdPersistName)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Builds a key-value pair and adds it to the list of key-value pairs. If the InfoNode is compound, then the PersistenceRenderer may refer back to the KeyValueBuilder to build out the compound node.
        Parameters:
        infoNode - The current InfoNode in the semantic model.
        key - The current key. The key is constructed by appending persistence names, which may or may not be decorated, to the current key. In this way it represents a flattening of the semantic model.
        keyValues - The current list of key-value pairs
        isWithholdPersistName - true if the renderer implementation should not append the InfoNode's persistence name to the key.

      • isZeroOutPersistName

        protected boolean isZeroOutPersistName(InfoNode node)
        Returns true if we have specified that when the collection element is a compound element of the certain types, then we zero out the node's persistence name. For example, when we have a List< Map< String, String > > called listOfMaps, then for each list element, we have a Map, and so we would want to render it as listOfMap[i]{key}. Similarly, if we have a List< List< Double > > called matrix, we would want to render it as matrix[i][j].
        Parameters:
        node - The node containing the compound collection element
        Returns:
        true if the persistence name of the node should be zeroed out.

      • createNodeKey

        protected final java.lang.String createNodeKey(java.lang.String key,
                             InfoNode parentNode,
                             int index)
        Creates a key for a node collection. For example, if the persist name for a List is people, which is a List< Person >, then the key will be people[i].Person where the i is the index of the list.
        Parameters:
        key - The current key to which to append the persisted name and decorated index
        parentNode - The parent node, which holds the name of the field (in this example, "people")
        node - The current node (in this example, "Person")
        index - The index of the element in the List
        Returns:
        The key

      • buildInfoNode

        public void buildInfoNode(InfoNode parentNode,
                 java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> keyValues)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Builds an InfoNode and adds it to the parent node, using the specified list of key-value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.
        Parameters:
        parentNode - The parent InfoNode to which to add the newly created child(ren).
        keyValues - The associated list of key value pairs. Each key in the list of key-value pairs should have its first key-element's group name equal to the persistence name in the parent node.

      • isRenderer

        public boolean isRenderer(java.lang.String keyElement)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Returns true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        keyElement - The element of the key to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified key matches the pattern created by the renderer; false otherwise

      • getGroupName

        public java.lang.String getGroupName(java.lang.String key)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceRenderer
        Returns the group name for the key. For example, if the key is "people{"test"}[0].Person" then the group name from the MapRenderer will be "people"
        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to extract the group name
        Returns:
        the group name for the key

      • getCopy

        public CollectionRenderer getCopy()
        Description copied from interface: Copyable
        Creates and returns a copy of the object x that meets the following criteria
        1. The expressions x.getCopy() != x evaluates as true
        2. The expressions x.getCopy().equals( x ) evaluates as true
        3. The expressions x.getCopy().getClass() == x.getClass() evaluates as true
        Returns:
        a copy of the object that meets the above criteria
